answers.answer: Good luck , no need for any advice bein yur already a veteran.
Happy birthday!!! I wish you the best this time around. I figure you're going to be fine having come through all that you've  had to deal with. I wish you good luck and easy sides. Mike
Happy Birthday!  Best of luck on this treatment journey.  Sounds like you have been through a lot.  You will come through this with flying colors, and free of this virus!

Best of luck to you...It's been said the second time around is de charm.....So "Cinco de Viro"Next week I'll take my 6th year PCR (a 2b also)after treating twice~hopefully still undetected....YOU CAN DO IT TOO !Pozzy

Ah it sounds to me like you already have this thing BEAT!  With your attitude...it would have to be nuts to even fight you on that fact!  :)Best of luck...just imagine next year on your birthday you can celebrate being virus free!!!!!!!!!   :)I'm on week 32 tonight as a 1A and 1B...I can't wait till the day it's over!

HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!!  I too will have a birthday on the 12th.  I'm a 2B also and going on my 18th shot.  Hearing that you relapsed is wearing on my mind.  There has been a few 2's lately that have not cleared the virus.  What was your base VL?  Mine was 318,000 and I'm on peg-intron, 800 riba a day.  I pray this time you clear this bug once and for all.BEAGLE
Glad to see you here, and wishing you the best. Take care
Welcome.  Glad you stopped lurking.  Sounds like you have really been through a lot.  THis one will be a charm, I am sure.  Like your attitude - tell us tomorrow how smooth it went.frijole
Welcome back to "ribo rage".... =)Happy Happy Birthday to you!I, too, have been lurking but not posting... I did my "intro" on a previous post.Is it common for type 2's to do multiple tx?
Welcome to the forum.Look forward to reading more from you, and how things are going for you.HAPPY BIRTHDAY!lilmoma
WOW...thank you for your support..I have been lurking here for a while and I must say "you guys are the best!!"I will post after the first shot and let you all know how easy it was.....alan

Good luck and go get it!! Don't stop till it's over. I'm just about ready to start Tx. I'll probably be starting next week, just waiting to hear back about my Thyroid #'s.When I heard about the Riba rage, I though it was a fringe benefit as well. Now I'll have something to blame my somewhat overamped reactions on. Well, I'll keep the prayers comin' for you.Peace,Pauly

question: Hi all my fellow heppers I am starting tx this friday for the second time after taking a few years off in between treatments...I have had to deal with kidney cancer and diabetes since I finished my first tx five years ago (a liver scan showed a growth on my kidney and definetly save my life). Ironic isn't it thay hep c saved me from finding my cancer too late? I'm a 2B genotype and I hope to clear this evil virus permanently..Last time, I cleared the virus(regular interferon 3 times weekly plus ribo) and then relapsed shortly after finishing the tx... I'm looking forward to having an excuse for my "ribo rage"....Also I gotta a big B-day tommorow (busy week) wish me luck....alan
title: Starting TX  tonight
